sequence:
Centaur and the Port "Elders"

<size=45>Chapter 3 - The Meaning of Respect</size>

scripts.say: The business of Centaur calling everyone "Elder" had become the talk of the fleet.
Hmmm...? Why is it I call everyone "Elder?" ... Commander, you know I was born after the War, don't you?
Since the fighting was already over, there was a chance our entire class of ships would be cancelled.
But in the end, for whatever reason, we came to be.
However, with the War behind us, we never had a chance at the glorious, tumultuous lives of our Elders.
I would be lying if I said I didn't yearn for that excitement.
And yet, it's more than that.
Commander, I lived my life in a world of peace. I have never known the horrors of war.
But the more I learn of the deeds of my storied Elders, the more I have come to understand what war is.
It is not something that I, who has never experienced that hell, can invoke so cavalierly.
That is why I so deeply respect and admire those Elders who fought in the War, and even more so those who did not survive it.
In fact, the word "Elder" cannot adequately express the level of esteem to which I hold them.
Centaur appeared lost in her thoughts.
But if I'm causing trouble then perhaps I've miscalculated...
I'll talk it over with everyone. If some Elders are bothered by it, I'll do what I can to show my respect through my actions rather than words.~
I realized I had no reason to worry about Centaur, at least with this "Elder" business.
